Package se.arkalix.net.http.service

Class HttpCatcher<T extends java.lang.Throwable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.net.http.service.HttpCatcher<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpRoutable
    public class HttpCatcher<T extends java.lang.Throwable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpRoutable
    A HttpService exception catcher, useful for handling errors occurring while receiving or responding to HTTP requests.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HttpCatcher​(int ordinal, HttpMethod method, HttpPattern pattern, java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass, HttpCatcherHandler<T> handler)
      Creates new HttpService exception catcher.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpCatcher

        public HttpCatcher​(int ordinal,
                   HttpMethod method,
                   HttpPattern pattern,
                   java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass,
                   HttpCatcherHandler<T> handler)
        Creates new HttpService exception catcher.
        Parameters:
        ordinal - When to execute the catcher relative to other catchers. Lower numbers are executed first.
        method - HTTP method that must be matched by caught request exceptions. Use null to allow any method.
        pattern - HTTP pattern that must be matched by caught request exceptions. Use null to allow any path.
        exceptionClass - Type caught exceptions must be assignable to. Use null to allow all exceptions.
        handler - The handler to execute with matching requests.

    • Method Detail

      • ordinal

        public int ordinal()
        Returns:
        Integer indicating when to execute this catcher in relation to other catchers that match the same methods, patterns and exception.

      • method

        public java.util.Optional<HttpMethod> method()
        Specified by:
        method in interface HttpRoutable
        Returns:
        HttpMethod, if any, that requests causing thrown exceptions must match for this catcher to be invoked.

      • pattern

        public java.util.Optional<HttpPattern> pattern()
        Specified by:
        pattern in interface HttpRoutable
        Returns:
        HttpPattern, if any, that paths of requests causing thrown exceptions must match for this catcher to be invoked.

      • exceptionClass

        public java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass()
        Returns:
        Class that caught exceptions must be assignable to for this catcher to be invoked.

      • tryHandle

        public Future<java.lang.Boolean> tryHandle​(java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                                           HttpRouteTask task)
        Tries to make this catcher handle the given exception.

        The exception will only be handled if the given task request matches the method, pattern and exception class of this catcher, and the handler this class wraps reports that it did handle it.

        Parameters:
        throwable - Exception causing this handler to be invoked.
        task - Incoming HTTP request route task.
        Returns:
        Future completed when catching is complete. Its value is true only if the throwable was handled.
